intro: Vitis nesbittiana, commonly known as the Nesbitt grapevine, is a species of flowering plant in the Vitaceae family. It is native to eastern North America, particularly found in the southeastern United States. The plant is a vigorous climbing vine with tendrils that allow it to ascend trees and other structures. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. The fruit, which is a small grape, is usually dark purple or black when mature.
